intro: Erucastrum meruense subsp. yemenense, commonly known as Yemen cress, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. It produces small, yellow flowers and has pinnately divided leaves. Its seeds are often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
